result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Antonacci was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David A. Antonacci is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David A. Antonacci was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay fine + costs within 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A. Antonacci

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David A. Antonacci in court with attorney Steven Michael Cohen.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached. Victim rights compliance. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. Def enters NC plea to Ct 2 Dom DC as charged. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of Ct 2; Ct 1 is Dismissed. ADA Thompson heard. Atty Cohen heard. Court heard and imposes sentence:

$200 fine + costs w/in 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts.
Defendant states will be paying today - Court agrees.
Spoke to Atty Cohen to tell him we need a Stip and Order to continue the 5/18/15 hrg
and inspection and time to file additional pretrial motions

Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Defendant shall submit a DNA sample at the Dodge County Jail.  Any defendant submitting a DNA sample may ask to have it expunged if applicable charges are dismissed  see Wis. Stat. Sec. 165.77(4).

9:33 - Defendant, David A. Antonacci in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea for the defendant. RD & JT set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division. DNA sample required.   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
